title: 110_hr7279
content: The "Seniors' Investment Security Act of 2008" suspends minimum distribution requirements. The "Seniors' Investment Security Act of 2008" suspends minimum distribution requirements for defined contribution plans from January 1, 2008, to December 31, 2010. During this suspension period, specific calendar year rules are adjusted, and no part of the suspension period is counted towards time limitations after it ends. During the suspension period from January 1, 2008, to December 31, 2010, certain sections apply to defined contribution plans and eligible deferred compensation plans. Plan amendments must comply with the terms during this period. This section applies to plan or annuity contract amendments made by January 1, 2010, pursuant to regulations issued by the Treasury Secretary. Amendments must meet conditions during the suspension period from January 1, 2008, to December 31, 2010. The section applies to plan or annuity contract amendments made by January 1, 2010, with retroactive application during the suspension period from January 1, 2008, to December 31, 2010. It takes effect on the date of the enactment of this Act. During the suspension period from January 1, 2008, to the enactment of this Act, individuals can contribute payments or distributions to an eligible retirement plan. Repayments of distributions from eligible retirement plans other than IRAs are treated under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. During the suspension period from January 1, 2008, to the enactment of this Act, individuals can contribute payments or distributions to an eligible retirement plan. Contributions made to eligible retirement plans other than IRAs are treated as eligible rollover distributions under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. During the suspension period, individuals can contribute payments or distributions to an eligible retirement plan. If contributions are made to an individual retirement plan, they will be treated as a distribution and transferred within 60 days.
